title: 114_hr2860
content: The District of Columbia National Guard Educational Assistance Program is added as a new title under the Act for the organization of the militia of the District of Columbia. It includes a short title and findings. The District of Columbia National Guard is unique and differs from other National Guards due to its federalized status and special mission in the presence of the Federal Government in the District. The President of the United States commands the District of Columbia National Guard, which is trained for unique emergencies related to the Federal Government presence. Most members live in Maryland or Virginia, leading to a disproportionate decline in force compared to neighboring National Guards. The District of Columbia National Guard faces challenges in maintaining necessary force levels due to members being drawn to nearby National Guards in Maryland and Virginia. Providing educational benefits could help retain members and ensure readiness. The District of Columbia National Guard's readiness could be impacted by members being drawn to nearby National Guards in Maryland and Virginia, potentially affecting their response to a terrorist attack on the capital. SEC. 202. DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NATIONAL GUARD EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. The Mayor of the District of Columbia, in coordination with the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard, will establish a program to provide financial assistance to eligible National Guard members for higher education expenses. Eligibility is based on certification from the commanding general. The Mayor of the District of Columbia, in coordination with the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard, has established a program to provide financial assistance to eligible National Guard members for higher education expenses. Eligibility requires completion of initial active duty service, a written agreement to serve for at least 6 years, and not receiving a Reserve Officer Training Corps scholarship. To maintain eligibility, members must perform duty satisfactorily as certified by the commanding general. The District of Columbia National Guard offers financial assistance for higher education expenses to eligible members who have completed initial active duty service, agreed to serve for at least 6 years, and are not receiving a Reserve Officer Training Corps scholarship. Eligible members must be enrolled in an approved institution of higher education, seeking to earn 3-12 credit hours per semester, and maintain satisfactory progress in their course of study. SEC. 203. Treatment of assistance provided. Financial assistance for members of the District of Columbia National Guard can be used for tuition, fees, books, and laboratory expenses. The assistance can be up to $400 per credit hour, not exceeding $6,000 per year. The Mayor may adjust the amount or limit participants if funds are insufficient. Members of the District of Columbia National Guard can receive financial assistance for education in addition to other benefits. Failure to fulfill service obligations may result in repayment requirements under the program. "SEC. 204. ADMINISTRATION AND FUNDING OF PROGRAM." The Mayor, along with the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard and approved institutions of higher education, will develop policies for the program. No changes to admissions policies are required for Guard members. Appropriations are authorized for financial assistance, with funds remaining available until expended. The Mayor can accept funds transfers from Federal agencies and donations of services or property for providing assistance under the program. Authorized appropriations are available until expended. The term 'approved institution of higher education' in this title refers to an eligible institution that participates in student financial assistance programs and agrees to use funds to supplement, not replace, other assistance for members of the District of Columbia National Guard. Financial assistance can be provided to eligible Guard members for instruction starting on or after January 1, 2015.
